title: Making the case for organic farming and for a low external input sustainable agriculture

tasks.task: Presenting case studies on climate change mitigation and adaptation through agricultural practices.
subtasks: Discussing the basic design of biodigesters and their benefits, including biogas, organic fertilizer, and carbon sequestration.
Presenting the African Biocast Partnership Programme and its carbon project successes in Kenya and Indonesia.
Introducing the Soylent More methodology for measuring carbon impact from bioslurry and discussing user surveys and baseline scenario projections.
Presenting the PASCAFEN project in Nicaragua, focusing on sustainable agriculture practices, carbon sequestration, and livelihood improvements.
Discussing household survey results from the Peruvian Andes, comparing agroecological farmers to conventional farmers in terms of food security, livelihood capital, and climate resilience.
Addressing the innovative aspects of the discussed projects, such as combining carbon finance with market-based approaches and social capital.
Covering the role of private sectors, financial institutions, and governments in scaling sustainable agricultural practices.
Highlighting the potential of carbon markets to finance soil and land restoration projects for climate change mitigation and food security adaptation.
